overfit.note: HMM model uses Optuna MI-based objective, no train/val loss ratio applicable

mi.note: MI increase 4.96% - marginally below 5% threshold. Down from attempt 1 (17.12%) due to dimensionality reduction from 3 to 1 column.

stability.note: Stability marginally above 0.15 threshold (0.1555). Consistent with regime-switching nature of HMM outputs seen in VIX (pass), Technical (fail at 0.21), Cross-Asset (fail at 0.156), ETF Flow (fail at 0.162).

comparison_to_attempt_1.note: MI decrease expected: 3 columns had total MI = sum of 3 features. Single column retains strongest signal only.

notes.mae_improvement: MAE delta -0.1562 is 15.6x the threshold (-0.01). MAE improved in 4/5 folds.
notes.comparison_to_attempt_1: Attempt 1 had DA degraded in ALL 5 folds. Attempt 2 has DA improved in 3/5 folds. MAE improved in 4/5 folds vs 2/5 in attempt 1.
notes.feature_rank: options_risk_regime_prob ranked #2/20 in feature importance (7.55%), up from #2/22 (5.70%) in attempt 1.

decision_rationale: Gate 1 PASS. Gate 2 FAIL (MI 4.96% marginally below 5%, stability 0.1555 marginally above 0.15). Gate 3 PASS via MAE criterion (-0.1562, 15.6x threshold, 4/5 folds improved). This follows precedent set by 6 other submodels that passed Gate 3 despite Gate 2 failures (VIX, Technical, Cross-Asset, Yield Curve, ETF Flow, CNY Demand). The dimensionality reduction from 3 to 1 column successfully eliminated the noise problem from attempt 1: DA degraded in 0/5 folds in attempt 1 but improved in 3/5 folds in attempt 2. Feature importance rank unchanged at #2 while actual importance increased from 5.70% to 7.55%. MAE improvement is strong and consistent across folds.
